name: Optional
comment:
A value that might be absent.

Use Optional as an alternative to allowing fields, parameters or return values to be null. It signals that a value is not required and provides convenience methods for dealing with the absent case.

orNull.name: orNull
orNull.comment: Gets the Optional value, or null if there is none.

value.name: value
value.comment:
Gets the Optional value.

Throws dart-core.StateError if quiver/quiver-core.Optional.value is null.

fromNullable.name: fromNullable
fromNullable.comment:
Constructs an Optional of the given quiver/quiver-core.Optional.Optional-fromNullable.value.

If quiver/quiver-core.Optional.Optional-fromNullable.value is null, returns absent().

of.name: of
of.comment:
Constructs an Optional of the given quiver/quiver-core.Optional.Optional-of.value.

Throws dart-core.ArgumentError if quiver/quiver-core.Optional.Optional-of.value is null.

ifAbsent.name: ifAbsent
ifAbsent.comment: Execution a function if the Optional value is absent.

ifPresent.name: ifPresent
ifPresent.comment: Executes a function if the Optional value is present.

or.name: or
or.comment:
Gets the Optional value with a default.

The default is returned if the Optional is absent().

Throws dart-core.ArgumentError if quiver/quiver-core.Optional.or.defaultValue is null.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

transform.name: transform
transform.comment:
Transforms the Optional value.

If the Optional is absent(), returns absent() without applying the transformer.

The transformer must not return null. If it does, an dart-core.ArgumentError is thrown.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides quiver/quiver-core.Optional.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and quiver/quiver-core.Optional.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the quiver/quiver-core.Optional.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
quiver/quiver-core.Optional.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to quiver/quiver-core.Optional.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If quiver/quiver-core.Optional.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of quiver/quiver-core.Optional.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
